info.title: VPN Gateway API
info.description: A simple API to manage tunnel entries on a dedicated host within the edges. The VPN Gateway is used to encrypt traffic before it enters the first black network.

inner_subnet.description: The subnet to route towards the inner interface (aka. the edge network/device)

local_port.description: The local port to use to bind the tunnel

remote_end.description: The remote address to contact as the other side of the tunnel

private_key.description: The private key to use for authentication of the tunnel to the other side

public_key.description: The public key to use for authentication of the tunnel from the other side

matches.description: A specification for which packets to transport through the tunnel

items.description: A match entry specifying packets that should be routed through the tunnel

source_ip.description: Specifies the source ip to be matched. Leave empty for no matching.

target_ip.description: Specifies the target ip to be matched. Leave empty for no matching.

source_mac.description: Specifies the source mac to be matched. Leave empty for no matching.

source_port.description: Specifies the source port to be matched. Leave empty or on 0 for no matching.

target_port.description: Specifies the target port to be matched. Leave empty or on 0 for no matching.

post.description: Issues a new authentication token in exchange for credentials. Currently requires no credentials, this is up to future implementations.

/tunnel_entry.summary: Manages tunnel entries on the vpn gateway

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The authentication token issued by prior login

200.description: The current list of tunnel entries

put.description: Creates a new tunnel entry or updates one. Only updating of match entries is allowed - not the rest of the tunnel parameters.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The authentication token issued by prior login

requestBody.description: The tunnel entry to create or update. The id will be inherited from the request.

201.description: The tunnel entry has been created

202.description: The tunnel entry has been updated

404.description: A specified interface could not be found

406.description: A value exceeds the allowed range

409.description: A tunnel entry with this id already exists and information apart from match entries was changed.

412.description: A value does not match the schema

507.description: Already too many tunnel entries in use

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The authentication token issued by prior login

parameters.name: tunnel_entry_id
parameters.description: The id of the tunnel entry to be deleted.

200.description: The tunnel entry was successfully deleted.

404.description: The tunnel entry could not be found.
